references.reason: This paper provides technical details of GPT-4, a leading large language model (LLM), directly relevant to the AI-generated text detection methods discussed in the paper.
This paper introduces Claude 3, another significant LLM used in the study's experiments, which impacts the accuracy and generalizability of the AI-generated text detection results.

references.paper_title: GLTR: Statistical detection and visualization of generated text
references.reason: This paper is an important baseline method for detecting AI-generated text using statistical approaches, providing a direct point of comparison for the new methods proposed.

references.paper_title: RaidAR: generative AI detection via rewriting
references.reason: This is a state-of-the-art AI-generated text detection method that utilizes rewriting as a technique, providing a strong benchmark for the detection accuracy of other methods.

references.paper_title: GPTZero: Towards detection of AI-generated text using zero-shot and supervised methods
references.reason: This paper introduces GPTZero, a leading commercial AI-generated text detection tool, serving as a key benchmark for comparing the performance of the proposed approach against a commercially available solution.
